Here are the main free and open‑source cybersecurity auditing tools mentioned:

- SonarQube Community Edition – Multi-language static analysis and code quality/security gates.[1][2]
- Semgrep – Fast, rule-based static analysis for 30+ languages, easy custom rules.[3][4]
- CodeQL – GitHub’s semantic code analysis engine with deep vulnerability queries.[5][6]
- Bandit – Python-focused security scanner for common vulnerabilities and bad patterns.[7][8]
- Brakeman – Static security scanner tailored for Ruby on Rails apps.[9][10]
- eslint-plugin-security – ESLint ruleset targeting security issues in Node.js/JS.[11][12]
- eslint-plugin-security-rules – Additional security-focused ESLint ruleset.[13]
- NodeJsScan – Static security code scanner built for Node.js applications.[14][15]
- Bearer – Privacy- and data-security-focused SAST with OWASP/CWE-aligned rules.[16]
- Horusec – Multi-language SAST and secrets scanning with CLI and web UI.[17]
- OWASP ZAP – Dynamic web app security scanner and proxy for OWASP Top 10 issues.[18][19]
- OpenVAS – Network and infrastructure vulnerability scanner within Greenbone stack.[20][21]
